text: Human immunodeficiency virus type 1 <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein inhibits NF-kappa B induction in human T cells .
Human immunodeficiency virus type 1 ( HIV-1 ) can establish a persistent and latent infection in <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T lymphocytes ( W.C.Greene , N.Engl.J .
Med.324 : 308-317 , 1991 ; S.M.Schnittman , M.C.Psallidopoulos , H.C . Lane , L.Thompson , M.Baseler , F.Massari , C.H.Fox , N.P.Salzman , and A.S.Fauci , Science 245 : 305-308 , 1989 ) .

Production of HIV-1 from latently infected cells requires host cell activation by T-cell mitogens ( T.Folks , D.M.Powell , M.M.Lightfoote , S.Benn , M.A . Martin , and A.S.Fauci , Science 231 : 600-602 , 1986 ; D.Zagury , J . Bernard , R.Leonard , R.Cheynier , M.Feldman , P.S.Sarin , and R.C . Gallo , Science 231 : 850-853 , 1986 ) .
This activation is mediated by the host transcription factor NF-kappa B [ G.Nabel and D.Baltimore , Nature ( London ) 326 : 711-717 , 1987 ] .
We report here that the HIV-1-encoded <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein inhibits the induction of NF-kappa B DNA - binding activity by T - cell mitogens .

However , <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> does not affect the DNA - binding activity of other transcription factors implicated in HIV-1 regulation , including <extra_id_0> SP-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , USF , URS , and NF-AT .

text: Additionally , <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits the induction of HIV-1 - and <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - directed gene expression , and the effect on HIV-1 transcription depends on an intact NF-kappa B - binding site .

These results indicate that defective recruitment of NF-kappa B may underlie <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> 's negative transcriptional effects on the HIV-1 and <extra_id_0> interleukin 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoters .

text: Further evidence suggests that <extra_id_0> Nef <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits NF-kappa B induction by interfering with a signal derived from the T-cell receptor complex .
